Title: Sexual harassment: dRPC ₦5m support project scales up intervention in Bingham varsity
Summary: The Development Research and Projects Centre (dRPC) is supporting the International Centre for Investigative Reporting (ICIR) with a N5 million grant to scale up its intervention project in universities .

Title: Incentives for bandits: ONSA counters El-Rufai’s
Summary: ONSA has described as baseless the claim by former Kaduna State Governor, Mallam Nasir El-Rufai, that the government coordinates a policy of payments and offers incentives to bandits . ONSA described the claim as baseless .

Title: Otu orders police officer’s arrest over death of 23-year-old man
Summary: Cross River State Government has strongly condemned what it described as a “brazen act of lawlessness and abuse of authority” following the tragic death of 23-year-old Onyekachi Moses in Calabar .

Title: Miami’s Suarez at center of spitting incident after Leagues Cup loss
Summary: Luis Suarez appeared to spit at a staff member of the opposing team during an ugly brawl following Inter Miami's 3-0 loss to the Seattle Sounders in the Leagues Cup final on Sunday . Inter Miami’s Suarez at the center of the spitting incident after the loss .

Title: Tinubu highlights success stories, assures on Renewed Hope Agenda
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has assured Nigerians that his government is bent on delivering the dividends of democracy as promised when he took over power . In a post shared on his verified X account in the early hours of Monday, September, he highlights success stories, assures on Renewed Hope Agenda .

Title: Simon Ekpa jailed six years in Finland for terrorism crimes
Summary: The Finnish court ruled that Ekpa had used his ‘significant social media following’ to escalate tensions in Nigeria’s south-east . Ekpa was jailed for six years in Finland for terrorism crimes .

Title: Morocco set to be first African qualifiers for 2026 World Cup
Summary: Morocco set to be first African qualifiers for 2026 World Cup . The Moroccans top the table with 15 points from five matches in a mini-league reduced from six teams to five by the withdrawal of Eritrea before matchday 1 .

Title: Akpabio mourns Ex-IGP Arase, consoles Nigeria Police
Summary: Akpabio said Nigeria has missed a gentleman and fine officer . He consoled his family, the entire Nigerian police community, and the people and government of Edo State .

Title: El-Rufai’s remarks on Southern Kaduna divisive, says CAN leader Hayab
Summary: CAN leader describes El-Rufai's remarks on Southern Kaduna as 'dangerous and divisive' Reverend Hayab described the former governor’s remarks as “dangerous’

Title: Afghanistan earthquake kills over 800
Summary:
The earthquake struck just before midnight, shaking buildings from Kabul to neighbouring Pakistan's capital, Islamabad.
The post Afghanistan earthquake kills over 800 appeared first on Vanguard News.

Title: 2027: If you want to destroy PDP bring Obi - Wike
Summary: The Minister of the Federal Capital Territory, Nyesom Wike, has warned that the PDP risks self-destruction if it attempts to bring back former Labour Party presidential candidate, Peter Obi, into its fold . Wike said the party had not learned from past mistakes that cost it dearly in the 2023 general elections .

Title: Suárez involved in spitting incident after Inter Miami’s Leagues Cup collapse
Summary: Luis Suárez appeared to spit at a member of the Seattle Sounders’ coaching staff following Inter Miami’s 3-0 defeat in the Leagues Cup final, adding further controversy to a heated end to the match . The incident occurred moments after the final whistle, during a tense confrontation between players and staff from both teams .

Title: Pakistan army helicopter crash kills five
Summary: Helicopter came down in a mountainous tourist area in Diamer district, in Gilgit Baltistan, around 10:00 am (0500 GMT) It comes just weeks after a government MI-17 helicopter crashed in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province while carrying out flood relief efforts .

Title: FG admits financial crisis in foreign missions, pledges reforms
Summary: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has publicly acknowledged the ongoing financial and operational challenges facing several Nigerian diplomatic and consular missions abroad . The ministry cited budgetary constraints and foreign exchange policy shifts as key contributing factors .

Title: UPDATED: Leverkusen sack Erik Ten Hag after two league matches
Summary: Bayer Leverkusen have sacked manager Erik Ten Hag after just two Bundesliga matches in charge, the club announced on Monday . The 55-year-old Dutchman joined the club in the summer as the successor to Xabi Alonso, who moved to Real Madrid . Ten Hag won the FA and League Cups with Manchester United in July 2022,
